isis.stitle: HEAT VENTILATION AIR CONDITIONING (HVAC), Orifice Tube System, Pre-March 2007 - 3200, 4100, 4200, 4300, 4400, 7300, 7400, 7500, 7600, 7700, 8500, 8600 - HVAC CONTROL HEAD CIRCUITS - FAULT DETECTION MANAGEMENT

svcproc.title: FAULT DETECTION MANAGEMENT

note.para: The testing method for troubleshooting the electrical systems covered in this manual is a basic voltage test. An alternate method of checking for voltage drops within a given circuit may be a quicker method of identifying an exact problem.

svcproc.para: This section describes the symptoms that may result from a failure in the HVAC control head circuits. A list of the possible causes of the circuit failure is also provided. Table 23 lists and describes the Diagnostic Trouble Codes associated with the HVAC control head circuits. Table 24 provides the troubleshooting procedures for isolating the cause of the failure.

A possible failure of the HVAC control head circuits is indicated when any of the circuits or functions controlled by the control head fail to operate correctly. Any of the following symptoms could indicate a failure of the HVAC control head circuits:

item.para: loss of control of the HVAC system recirculation/fresh air intake. Refer to RECIRCULATION ACTUATOR MOTOR CIRCUIT
loss of control of the HVAC system in-cab air distribution. Refer to MODE ACTUATOR MOTOR CIRCUIT
loss of control of HVAC system blower. Refer to BLOWER MOTOR CIRCUIT
loss of control of HVAC system air temperature. Refer to TEMPERATURE ACTUATOR MOTOR CIRCUIT
loss of control of the AC compressor (AC modes and defrost modes)
mechanical failure of one of the controls on the HVAC control head
failure of the panel lighting on the control head
illumination of the "CHECK AC" warning light
logging of any of the HVAC control head diagnostic trouble codes

svcproc.para: A failure in the operation of the HVAC control head circuits could be attributed to any of the following conditions:

item.para: power circuits (BATT and IGN), open or shorted to ground, or fuse blown
ground circuit open
control head AC Request circuit open or shorted to ground (AC compressor cannot be controlled)
diagnostic communication circuit open or shorted to ground
panel light circuit, open or shorted to ground, external or internal to the control head

a control or circuit within the control head is defective (refer to the section covering the malfunctioning circuit or component: MODE ACTUATOR MOTOR CIRCUIT, BLOWER MOTOR CIRCUIT, TEMPERATURE ACTUATOR MOTOR CIRCUIT, or RECIRCULATION ACTUATOR MOTOR CIRCUIT.

svcproc.para: Refer to HVAC CONTROL HEAD POWER CIRCUITS diagram.

table.title: HVAC Control Head Power and Diagnostic Circuits Diagnostic Trouble Codes

entry.para: HVAC multiple faults
This Diagnostic code is set when faults are sensed on two or more of the control head's output control circuits. The code is the result of faults sensed in two or more of the following circuits:

item.para: the recirculation motor circuit (refer to the section covering the RECIRCULATION ACTUATOR MOTOR CIRCUIT)
the mode actuator motor circuits (refer to the section covering the MODE ACTUATOR MOTOR CIRCUIT)
the temperature actuator circuits (refer to the section covering the TEMPERATURE ACTUATOR MOTOR CIRCUIT)

note.para: Always use breakout box ZTSE4477 to take measurements on ESC connectors.

entry.para: If a problem is found in two or more of the above circuits, repair those circuits and clear the diagnostic trouble code.

If a problem is not found in two or more of the above circuits; install the breakout box at ESC connector (1600), and check the status of the control head diagnostic line at connector (1600), terminal 8.

item.para: If the signal on the diagnostic line is an alternating voltage of 1 pulse per second (0.5 sec high/0.5 sec low), replace the HVAC control head. (Control head is indicating a multiple fault when none exists.)
low < 2 Vdc
high > 7 Vdc
If the signal on the diagnostic line is not an alternating voltage of 1 pulse per second, replace the ESC.

entry.para: HVAC control head fault
This Diagnostic code is set when communications between the HVAC control head and the ESC have been interrupted.
The code could be the result of any of the following conditions:

item.para: power circuits (BATT and IGN), open or shorted to ground, or fuse blown
ground circuit open
diagnostic communication circuit open or shorted to ground
defective HVAC control head
defective ESC

para.emph: HVAC Control Head Circuit Troubleshooting Chart

entry.para: Install breakout box ZTSE4477 at ESC connector (1600).
Disconnect HVAC control head connector (1200).
Check with ignition key ON.

note.para: Always use breakout box ZTSE4477 to take measurements on ESC connectors.
Always check connectors for damage and pushed-out terminals.

entry.para: Check with HVAC control head connector (1200) reconnected, breakout box ZTSE4477 installed at ESC connector (1600), and engine running at idle.

note.para: Always use breakout box to take measurements on ESC connectors.
Always check connectors for damage and pushed-out terminals.
